p: Tubers of Solanum tuberosum L. var. Desiree were grown in pots with a diameter of 18 cm containing sandy loam (1:1 loam soil:sand) in a glasshouse set at 20°C with a 16‐hr day length. Aliquots of 1,500 hatched, infective juveniles (J2s) of each species were added to the soil after three weeks of plant growth. Juveniles were hatched from G. pallida (pathotype Pa 2/3) or G. rostochiensis (pathotype Ro1) eggs within cysts at 20°C using root diffusate collected from three‐week‐old potato roots. J2s were washed four times in tap water and pipetted into the soil at three locations around the planted tuber at a density of one juvenile per μL water. Immediately after soil infestation, the potato plants were transferred to heat mats set at 15, 17.5, 20, 22.5 and 25°C in a glasshouse with a 16‐hr day length.
